results.title: The role of Helicobacter pylori in vitamin-B12 deficiency due to metformin use.
results.text_hl: However, the effects of increased @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ dose and @<m>DISEASE_Helicobacter_Infections</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D016481 @@@H pylori infection@@@ on @CHEMICAL_Vitamin_B_12 @CHEMICAL_MESH:D014805 @@@vitamin-B12@@@ levels were not additive.

results.title: The Relationship between Diabetes Mellitus and Gastric Cancer and the Potential Benefits of Metformin: An Extensive Review of the Literature
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ use may also reduce the risk of @<m>DISEASE_Helicobacter_Infections</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D016481 @@@HP infection@@@, an important risk factor of @DISEASE_Stomach_Neoplasms @DISEASE_MESH:D013274 @@@GCa@@@.

results.title: Helicobacter pylori-mediated gastric pathogenesis is attenuated by treatment of 2-deoxyglucose and metformin.
results.text_hl: Our findings demonstrate that the progression of gastric pathogenesis induced by @<m>DISEASE_Helicobacter_Infections</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D016481 @@@H. pylori infection@@@ can be attenuated by the short-term individual or combinational treatment of @CHEMICAL_Deoxyglucose @CHEMICAL_MESH:D003847 @@@2DG@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Met@@@, implying that @CHEMICAL_Deoxyglucose @CHEMICAL_MESH:D003847 @@@2DG@@@ or @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Met@@@ could be considered as a treatment option for @DISEASE_Stomach_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D013272 @@@gastric diseases@@@ in the early stages of @DISEASE_Infections @DISEASE_MESH:D007239 @@@infection@@@.

citations.NLM: Su H, Bak EJ, Kim A, Tissera K, Cha JH, Jang S. Helicobacter pylori-mediated gastric pathogenesis is attenuated by treatment of 2-deoxyglucose and metformin. J Microbiol. 2022 Aug;60(8):849-858. PMID: 35731346
citations.BibTeX: @article{35731346, title={Helicobacter pylori-mediated gastric pathogenesis is attenuated by treatment of 2-deoxyglucose and metformin.}, author={Su H and Bak EJ and Kim A and Tissera K and Cha JH and Jang S}, journal={J Microbiol}, volume={60}, number={8}, pages={849-858}}

results.title: Effectiveness of long-term low-dose aspirin in the prevention of gastric cancer after Helicobacter pylori eradication: study design and rationale of Ardabil gastric cancer randomized placebo-controlled prevention trial (AGCPT).
results.text_hl: BACKGROUND: In addition to @<m>DISEASE_Helicobacter_Infections</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D016481 @@@Helicobacter pylori (H. pylori) infection@@@ eradication, some medications, including @CHEMICAL_Aspirin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001241 @@@aspirin@@@, @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@, and statins, have been suggested to have protective effects against @DISEASE_Stomach_Neoplasms @DISEASE_MESH:D013274 @@@gastric cancer@@@ (@DISEASE_Stomach_Neoplasms @DISEASE_MESH:D013274 @@@GC@@@) development in observational studies.

citations.NLM: Pourfarzi F, Rashidi MM, Yazdanbod A, Nemati A, Dogaheh HP, Faghfuri E, Gorgani F, Hosseini-Asl S, Zamani B, Pourfarzi S, Etemadi A, Shafighian F, Rezaei N, Poustchi H, Malekzadeh R, Sadjadi A. Effectiveness of long-term low-dose aspirin in the prevention of gastric cancer after Helicobacter pylori eradication: study design and rationale of Ardabil gastric cancer randomized placebo-controlled prevention trial (AGCPT). Trials. 2024 Sep 19;25(1):617. PMID: 39300505

results.title: Gastrointestinal tract organoids as novel tools in drug discovery.
results.text_hl: These models have facilitated the study of the mechanisms and effects of various drugs, such as @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@, @CHEMICAL_schizandrin_C @CHEMICAL_MESH:C031409 @@@Schisandrin C@@@, and @CHEMICAL_Prednisolone @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011239 @@@prednisolone@@@, in these diseases.

citations.NLM: Zhou L, Luo D, Lu W, Han J, Zhao M, Li X, Shen T, Jin Z, Zeng J, Wen Y. Gastrointestinal tract organoids as novel tools in drug discovery. Front Pharmacol. 2024;15():1463114. PMID: 39281285
